meanings.definition: To stir up or arouse strong feelings in someone
meanings.sent1: The loud noise provoked fear in the little dog.
meanings.sent2: Her speech provoked a standing ovation from the audience.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten provoked laughter by chasing its own tail.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie provoked gasps from the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop provoked a sense of awe in the hikers.

meanings.definition: To incite or stimulate a reaction or response
meanings.sent1: The coach's pep talk provoked determination in the team.
meanings.sent2: The smell of freshly baked cookies provoked hunger in the children.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick provoked amazement from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The motivational video provoked inspiration in the students.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the painting provoked joy in the viewers.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become angry or irritated
meanings.sent1: His constant teasing provoked annoyance in his sister.
meanings.sent2: The long wait in line provoked frustration among the customers.
meanings.sent3: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet provoked irritation in the roommates.
meanings.sent4: The unfair treatment provoked anger in the employees.
meanings.sent5: The rude comments provoked a heated argument between the friends.
